creator: DA@ancalon.de
text:
The links on the compliance page
(http://xmlgraphics.apache.org/fop/compliance.html) are broken. This happened
probably on 05 December 2006, when the latest W3C Recommendation for XSL
(Version 1.1) was put online. The Links need to be rewritten to point to the new
destinations. Example: http://www.w3.org/TR/xsl/slice6.html#fo_root -->
http://www.w3.org/TR/xsl11/#fo_root .

Jan-Frederik Wilhelm

This should be fixed now (revisions 489455 and 489675). Thanks for reporting the
issue (we would have probably never noticed it otherwise!). Feel free to re-open
the bug if you still find dangling links.

Vincent Hennebert
creator: vhennebert@gmail.com

text: *** Bug 41282 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
creator: bowditch_chris@hotmail.com

text:
FYI, I've just locally merged in the fixes in the branch into a trunk working
copy and I'm in the process of uploading the generated site. I won't commit this
to avoid conflicts with the full merge back into trunk when the release is ready.
creator: jeremias@apache.org

text: batch transition pre-FOP1.0 resolved+fixed bugs to closed+fixed
creator: gadams@apache.org
